	Sir, can you state how did you see or how did you understand your political motive?  Can you explain to us your political motive for engaging in these acts for which you are applying for amnesty?

The political motive, it has been stated by my fellow applicants, and I don't think that we have to continue with the same question in different forms, because it has been answered by my fellow applicants and even my commander as a head of the unit.

But Mr Ndlovu, you are before us as an applicant, and if we had to look at you and say the others have answered for you, what would ...[indistinct] be saying what you said before us, which would be considered either to grant or refuse amnesty, we wouldn't be having that.  So it might be a repetition but please answer the questions as posed to you.
Can you indicate to us what your political motive was, or how did you understand your political motive at the time, when committing these acts.

The political motive was that I wanted to liberate our country from colonial forces and imperialist forces because our people were being under constant military attacks, assaults and tortures.   And again, to boost the moral of our people and to secure a clear environment for victory in our liberation struggle.

Help me if I'm wrong.  I don't know the ANC policies as well as you do, but was it also the ANC policy to act against colonialism or actions, or can you explain what the ANC policy was regarding these attacks?  How did you understand the ANC policy regarding the identification of targets.  Let's start there.

Actually what I can say is that when it comes to ANC policy, the policy of the African National Congress there's never mentioned in its political history that we should attack whites in particular.  And again there is no policy in the ANC that states that we should run amok attacking civilians, either black or white.
Who gave you your instructions Sir?
Sorry.  In the Wimpy Bar and the Katlehong incidents, who gave you your instructions in those incidents?

Actually in that question, the decision was taken after we have met and we have discussed extensively about the presence of the enemy at Wimpy Bar, but Wimpy Bar, it was not the actual target, our target was these people who were murdering our people and sustaining apartheid structures within our country.
And who did the reconnaissance in the Wimpy Bar incident?
Actually I was given the mandate to that, to do that reconnaissance.

Actually, the reports were as follows:  Every Saturday, because the enemy spent sleepless nights working overtime until Saturdays, Sundays, during the week.  The information was that the security, especially those who are from the higher ranks, were meeting there inside the Wimpy Bar to debrief their informers, to extract information from various operatives under their command.
Where did this information come from, where did you get this information from?
Actually the information, it was from the former political detainees around our country.
Sir, help me if I'm wrong please.  On your own you couldn't verify this, you heard this from other detainees, am I right?
Actually we got information from former political detainees, those who were involved in our revolution, that those policemen were buying food from Wimpy Bar and they are frequenting the area.
But have you seen this yourself, have you seen police actually buying, Security Branch police visiting and frequently the place, having meetings with informers, did you see this yourself?
How did you identify the Security Police, did you know them, because we all know they were wearing plain clothes?  Did you identify them yourself and the informers?

Actually I've seen them several times doing their job inside Wimpy Bar and so through continued reconnaissance we have decided, together with my fellow applicants, that our operation should be carried out.
But how did you know they were Security Branch police but just visiting the Wimpy Bar?

Actually they were using or utilising the cars which belonged to the state with the registration at the end, B and in the beginning, B.  So that is the identification that this vehicle belonged to the state.  Whatever they are wearing civilian clothing, an enemy is an enemy, it can't change.
Did you know there was a police kiosk just opposite the Wimpy Bar?
Our mandate or our main focus was not ...[intervention]
No, no, my question is: "Did you know there was a police kiosk opposite the Wimpy Bar"?

Actually what I can say is these are news and the new information for me.
But Sir, you did the reconnaissance.
You frequented this area, as I understand from your commanding officer, not once but a few times.

Yes, but the concentration was not on a kiosk, we wanted to hit the main target, the main planners.  Kiosk it was nothing because let's say we have attacked their seniors, it will put a direct impact on the psychology of apartheid.

NO RE-EXAMINATION BY MR KOOPEDI

Mr Ndlovu, my questions are going to be in respect of your reconnaissance with regard to the Wimpy bombing.
	I want to know how long it took you to do your reconnaissance in terms of days, in terms of weeks, in terms of months?
Actually we took several months monitoring that area.
I cannot remember because it's an old incident, but what I'm saying is that several months.
With whom were you when you were doing your reconnaissance?
And the information that you had received from the ex-detainees, what exactly did it contain?

Actually the information contained that when people were being captured for being involved in the liberation struggle, they could be taken to Benoni Police Station and then during the process of undergoing severe interrogation, they could be taken to the Wimpy and those security guys would buy food and eat there, went back to the police station.
So the information was that the people who were detained were taken to Wimpy by the security members, given food and then taken back to the police station for further interrogation?

What I'm saying is that they could be taken there - let's say they are inside this security cars and so the security personnel, they will went inside buy food and then they will come back and take them to the prison.  The other thing, they could go there on a daily basis for consultations or to plan other operations which we couldn't know.
So the information was that the security members were frequenting that particular Wimpy Bar on a daily basis?
And it wasn't that they went there on Saturdays?
Actually what they were doing is that they could frequent the area every day because enemy we knew that it was operating seven days in a week, because they couldn't rest.
What kind of information did you elicit from your reconnaissance?

Actually the information that I've got is that the enemy forces were frequenting the Wimpy Bar and on Saturday, specifically Saturday, they could organise a meeting there or take their lunch after their ...[indistinct] or extracting information from their ...[indistinct].
And how was this information obtained, how were you able to obtain this particular information with regard to the meeting on Saturdays?
Actually I've managed to extract the information because I was also using a Wimpy Bar to get food and to listen and to see the environment inside, what they are doing.
And in your frequenting the Wimpy Bar for purposes of collecting this kind of information, were you able to see whether there were any black patronage of that particular Wimpy Bar?

Actually in my position what I've noticed is that if the enemy is within the given territory with the support groups, meaning people who are supplying the enemy with information, they could be there always, especially on Saturday.
So in brief what you are saying is that you were able to observe black patronage in that particular Wimpy?
How big was that compared to the overall number of people that you were able to observe, for the past three months that you did your reconnaissance?
How big was the black presence of people who were patronising Wimpy?  You were able to do this reconnaissance for the past two to three months.
What I can say is that our people couldn't have a chance to enjoy themselves, especially in Wimpy Bars ...[intervention]
How big?  I'm talking of numbers.
I cannot remember but they were very, there were a few but what I can say, I'm not so sure if I can say there were a few.
Were you able to also observe the number of workers who were at Wimpy?
Generally I could say they were plus minus 6 or 7, not so sure.
And did you give this information to your command structure?
And was there any attitude adopted with regard to the presence of black people?
Actually what I can say is that when we planned to execute that operation, our main objective was to attack the enemy forces, not civilians as it has been stated.
Yes.  And how did you hope to achieve that, after you had seen that there was a small presence of black people frequenting that particular Wimpy?  How would you then have averted a civilian attack?

Actually I'm having a problem concerning the concept, civilian.  During the year 1985, our comrade President, Oliver Tambo, once spoke about a civilian and a policeman.  Now my problem is, how do you differentiate between a person in uniform and a person in civilian clothing but serving the same principle, being a policeman in disguise?
Did you take any precautions at all Mr Ndlovu, to avert any civilian casualty?  Can you honestly say that you did?
Did you take any precautions to avert any civilian casualties, in carrying out your operation in that particular Wimpy?
Can you explain what precautions you took?

The precaution is that during our operation we knew that that Wimpy Bar, especially 12 o'clock, the enemy forces will be there in large numbers and even their recruits in our townships, to supply them with information and to debrief their agents.  According to the area - according to the building itself, the Wimpy, it could not accommodate a large number of people and we know that by that time the enemy forces will be inside.
What time did you go into this particular Wimpy to plant the bomb?
If I could remember, if my memory serves me well, I was there plus minus ten, half past ten, I'm not sure.
I'm not saying half past, I'm saying from ten onwards until half past, I'm not so sure.

Of the people who were there when you went in at past ten, were you able to recognise any members of the Security Police?
As I'm saying that you could recognise the enemy presence.
I'm saying that you could recognise the enemy presence by the virtue of, they are utilising their state vehicles, meaning that they could be around there or waiting outside.
Were you able to identify any vehicles belonging to the state at that time?
Yes, because I have been carrying reconnaissance against the enemy forces.

If they were not inside, it simply means that they were on stand-by to attend a meeting,  Outside, they may be outside or whatever, corner.
They would be outside until about 12 o'clock, because your reconnaissance had actually elicited information that the meeting at about 12 o'clock, that's your evidence?
And they would be standing outside from about 10 o'clock until 12 o'clock?  Could that have been probable?

I'm not so sure about that because when I'm saying that - let's say somebody is attending a meeting, he can decide to stand outside.  Let's say like he will be taking a cigarette and smoke for a while ...[indistinct] to a meeting or he is still busy with somebody.
With regard to the Lindela Hostel attack, how many people did you actually shoot?

Actually you couldn't went back to the enemy forces and ask them that: "How many people have been attacked"?, but what has been happening is that you have been reading reports from media, especially from Citizen or whatever newspaper, if I remember very well.
From which position did you shoot at these people?

If you are unable to know how many people you shot at - did you shoot at a police vehicle with the "Kitskonstabels" inside the car or what happened?  How did the ambush take place?

Just two Chairperson.

Wimpy Bar had the hall, restaurant itself for eating inside and there were people who could also dine outside, would I be right?
